intro: Adenocalymma comosum var. nitidum, commonly known as the silky burr bush, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in spikes, followed by distinctive, fluffy, seed-bearing capsules. It thrives in sandy or clay soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas with a temperate climate. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
